verb.description: Cause to lose enthusiasm and initiative, especially as a result of a tedious or restrictive routine.
examples: the mentally stultifying effects of a disadvantaged home

verb.description: Cause (someone) to appear foolish or absurd.
examples: Counsel is not expected to stultify himself in an attempt to advance his client's interests

origin: Mid 18th century: from late Latin stultificare, from Latin stultus foolish.
